title: Work, Energy and Power
subject: Physics
learning_objectives: Understand the scientific meaning of work
Learn about different forms of energy
Apply the law of conservation of energy

sections.title: What is Work?
sections.content:
In physics, **work** is done when a force causes displacement of an object.

**Formula:** W = F × d × cos(θ)

Where:
• W = Work done (in Joules)
• F = Force applied (in Newtons)
• d = Displacement (in meters)
• θ = Angle between force and displacement

**Conditions for work:**
• Force must be applied
• Object must move (displacement)
• Force must have a component in the direction of motion

**When force is in direction of motion:** W = F × d

sections.title: Types of Energy
sections.content:
**Kinetic Energy (KE):** Energy possessed by a moving object.
Formula: KE = ½ × m × v²

**Potential Energy (PE):** Energy stored due to position or configuration.
• Gravitational PE = m × g × h
• Elastic PE (in springs)

**Other forms:**
• Heat energy
• Light energy
• Sound energy
• Chemical energy
• Electrical energy
• Nuclear energy

sections.title: Law of Conservation of Energy
sections.content:
**Statement:** Energy can neither be created nor destroyed. It can only be transformed from one form to another. The total energy of an isolated system remains constant.

**Examples:**
• A falling ball: PE → KE
• Photosynthesis: Light energy → Chemical energy
• Electric motor: Electrical energy → Mechanical energy
• Rubbing hands: Mechanical energy → Heat energy

**In free fall:** Total energy = PE + KE = constant
At top: All PE, zero KE
At bottom: Zero PE, all KE

sections.title: Power
sections.content:
**Power** is the rate of doing work or transferring energy.

**Formula:** P = W / t = Energy / Time

Where:
• P = Power (in Watts)
• W = Work done (in Joules)
• t = Time taken (in seconds)

**Units:**
• SI unit: Watt (W) = 1 Joule/second
• 1 kilowatt (kW) = 1000 W
• 1 horsepower (HP) = 746 W

**Commercial unit of energy:** kilowatt-hour (kWh)
1 kWh = 3.6 × 10⁶ Joules

key_points: Work = Force × Displacement (when force is in direction of motion)
Kinetic Energy = ½mv²; Potential Energy = mgh
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed
Power = Work / Time, measured in Watts

quiz_questions.question: What is the SI unit of work?
quiz_questions.explanation: The SI unit of work is Joule (J), which equals Newton-meter.

quiz_questions.question: A 2 kg ball is moving at 10 m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
When a ball is thrown upward, at the highest point it has:
quiz_questions.explanation: At the highest point, velocity is zero (KE = 0) and height is maximum (maximum PE).

quiz_questions.question: A machine does 5000 J of work in 10 seconds. What is its power?
